reviews.text: Would have liked to have given this a 4 or 5 star rating but can not.
reviews.title: Great cabins and location...shame about the beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked for a night the Buffalo Vista Bedroom Suite (Room 172) for a good price - $150 (as incorrectly stated on the website) instead of $200 that they initially asked. There was no complication and the staff said they'd honour the website price. $150 for a large cabin isn't bad at all!
reviews.title: A poor representation for a beautiful area

likes.liked: — Quiet location, convenient parking next to unit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabin is as pictured on the website - clean, nicely furnished, great bathroom with jetted tub and stone clad shower, stocked kitchenette, 1 tv/dvd/vhs combo in each room, TV reception good.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watch yourself on the hot water - a little too hot too fast and will burn if unprepared for it.
reviews.title: I Love ZMR ! !

likes.liked: — The scenery and tranquility ... my cell phone didn't work - YEAH!

reviews.title: True Heaven on Earth
reviews.text: Staff were friendly upon checkin and delivered extra sheets when asked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were looking forward to staying here after a long 2 weeks of touring on the road. A place to relax and unwind before heading home. It was a toss up between the Zion Park Lodge and this place as there aren't that many choices in the area. So we decided to splash out and spend the $130 on the resort as they were throwing in a free ATV ride on their website offer which we thought would be fun.
reviews.title: Don't stay here.
Great Spot
reviews.text: Here's what we actually got......A cabin but not the one pictured on their website. It is across from the resort right next to a busy main road. Ours was dirty and smelled of obnoxios toxic cleaning products. We had to keep all the doors and windows open to breathe. The shower was broken...my husband got it working for us. There is NO POOL and the sorry excuse for a hot tub was drained and full of leaves. The check in time is 4pm we got there at 5pm and was told that the ATV rides were done for the day. The next one was the next day which we couldn't do as we were coming home. So fed up that we paid the extra $$ for this dump just to get the ATV ride. Wishing we had chosen the lodge or someplace else.

The only place to eat for miles is at the resort. It is a greasy spoon meat joint. You can watch the buffalo herd ( which is the only pleasant experience here) whilst you watch your fellow diners eat buffalo meat. There are 5-6 dinner options at around $25 each.
reviews.title: Not thrilled with Zion Mountain... uggg Resort

likes.liked: — The east side of the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I took a spring trip to Vegas for a couple of days and then went on up to Zion and Bryce Canyon for some sightseeing. I decided to book Zion based on the fact that they were close to both parks and my wife and I wanted a relaxing time away from the kids.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at Zion Mountain Resort

likes.liked: — At the time we went it was a great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at Zion and the facilities at Zion Mountain Resort were very good. The accomodations were clean and comfortable and the staff was very knowlegable and friendly. Despite what a couple of reviews had to say it was not loud and we did not notice the road noise at all.
reviews.title: its going to be a time share soon!! Ugh!!

reviews.text: We also ate at the Buffalo Grill which was fantastic. At the time we went there in March there were not a lot of places open and we were very pleased to have such a good restaurant right at the Resort.
reviews.title: What a friendly and hospital reception we got .....

reviews.text: The main way that I determine whether to recommend a hotel or resort is whether it lives up to it's own billing on it's website. Zion Mountain Resort definately lived up to it's billing and I would definately stay there again if I am in the area.
reviews.title: Could have been better

reviews.text: We usually spend a week at Zion Nat'l Park each year at this time. The crowds are gone, the air crisp and beautiful for hiking.
reviews.title: Where the Buffalo Roam
